review: The FireTV stick was simple to set up, so I was optimistic, but once I tried to actually use it my experience went downhill rapidly.It took three updates for it to remember my wifi password, the controller sometimes lagged and was sometimes hyper-sensitive (a problem compounded by its insistence on using an Apple-copied round control instead of a cross-control).  I was able to log into Netflix, but unable to watch content.  Ditto for Amazon Prime video.  I would've tried an app, but it only supports Android, so none of my Windows Phones or devices can be used.Twice the lag got so bad that I unplugged it to reboot it because it simply became unresponsive (almost like Windows Media Center back in the Windows Vista days).  Finally I just gave up, unplugged it, and returned it.  It was a good first try, but the FireTV stick is not ready for prime-time.

review: Had this product for a few days now, I also own the fire tv, but wanted movies and music on another screen in the house and couldn't pass up the 20 stick. I will say it is much better than chrome cast for me personally, my only gripe so far has been that tv shows sometimes buffer right in the middle of a show.
